wikipedia_page.main: Walter Severn (12 October 1830 – 22 September 1904), professionally a civil servant, was known as an English water-colour artist.

response: * Claud Severn (1869–1933), British colonial governor of Hong Kong, son of Walter Severn
* Walter Severn (1830–1904), English watercolour artist, son of Joseph Severn

Sir Claud Severn was born on 9 September 1869 in Adelaide, South Australia, to Walter Severn (1830－1904) (at one time British Consul in Rome) and Mary Dalrymple Fergusson (1845-1916). His mother was the daughter of Sir Charles Dalrymple Fergusson, 5th Baronet.
*Mary Dalrymple-Fergusson (died 3 January 1916) - married to Walter Severn and mother of Sir Claud Severn, Colonial Secretary of Hong Kong (1912–1925)
